fcitx5.screen.incompatibleNotice.title: Incompatible System
fcitx5.screen.incompatibleNotice.content: Fcitx-Enhancer is only compatible with Linux, you can remove this mod safely.
fcitx5.screen.elementRuleEdit.title: Edit Element Rule
fcitx5.screen.screenRuleEdit.title: Edit Screen Rule
fcitx5.config.title: Fcitx5 Enhancer Configuration
fcitx5.config.general.imBlockerEnabled.t: Indicates if we should automatically deactivate & activate your IME according to your config, working like IMBlocker mod but with better performance.
fcitx5.config.general.restoreInitialStat: Restore IME State on Losing Focus

Automatically restores the initial input state of your IME when Minecraft window gets minimized or unfocused.

* If you have "Share Input State" enabled, please turn this option on.
fcitx5.config.general.selectElement.tool: If this key is pressed, we'll begin the element / screen selection guide, which makes adding user rules simpler.
Indicates if we should prevent your IME from activating when directly typing commands.

Including:
 - Clicking on key "%s"
 - Clicking on signs which have message components that suggests command

Indicates if we should deactivate your IME when typing a "/" in the input widget.

Including:
 - Open chat HUD firstly and then type a "/"
 - Clicking on messages that have components that suggests command
fcitx5.config.builtinRules.inventory.cre: Deactivate on Selecting Creative Search Element
Deactivate on Opening Screens of Interactable Blocks

Including:
 - Crafting Table, Stonecutter, etc.
 - Command Block, Structure Block, etc.
Deactivate on Opening Screens of Interactable Items
Deactivate on Selecting Anvil Rename Element
fcitx5.config.nativeWayland.preeditEnabl: Indicates if we should show an overlay displaying your preedit text when you're typing.
fcitx5.config.nativeWayland.preeditX.des: Indicates the X (horizonal) position of the overlay.
fcitx5.config.nativeWayland.preeditY.des: Indicates the Y (vertical) position of the overlay.
fcitx5.selector.none: Left-click on an element to select it, or right-click to select the whole screen. Press ESC to cancel.
